embeds.title: Equalize
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 8 (12) damage.
Heal 4 (6) HP.
**Consume** - Play this twice.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: pretty decent attack
mostly because it heals for quite a bit, 8(12) hp
the damage in and of itself is rather mediocre though
hefty upgrade
+8 dmg +4 hp
one of slime boss's many healing cards, and this is the most common
very splashable
obviously this card is trash because the only HP that matters is the last one
jk
24 dmg and healing for 12???? This card does NOT equalize anything, its broken and elevates every run you get it in
like just healing 12 for 2 energy is something hermit has as rare with ethereal and no damage
that's more of a statement about hermit IMO
and how that card is kind of boring
reprieve is still an great card though; its just far worse then this (all of the healing cards are expect for slime bosses OTHER healing card)
iirc if you play this against an enemy with <douse in slime> it gets to play a third time

embeds.title: Douse in Slime
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 3 (2) :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Apply 14 **Goop** :p_goop:.
The next Attack used on this enemy does not remove **Goop** :p_goop:.

messages.content: it equalizes nob
iirc current reprieve is supposed to be a temporary solution
I think that's what Alex said
they themselves know current reprieve is boring
I really liked this card, its the <Self Repair> trope of card, sure it has a conditional but its not hard to use

embeds.title: Self Repair
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

At the end of combat, heal 7 (10) HP.

messages.content: Healing is maybe a touch high, but thats about it
it also does damage
so it's even easier to use
16/24 for 2 is pretty bad damage for slime boss standards  admitably; but its all fine when you heal so much.
this card just has a stupid upgrade, like it almost doubles in strength
like I would be pretty happy to take this card if it just didn't do any damage; healing is one of the single most powerful things a card can do

I guess the other problem this card can have is your run becoming so powerful that its not useful anymore because your always at full HP.; which does happen on a character thats as good as blocking as slime boss is. Even then you can still use this card to heal of tackle chip damage.
ooooh that's cool
today I learned
I would most certainly not. Did you just forget that slime boss has a healing starter relic?
ya but you know whats better then healing 8 damage? healing 20 damage!
or even better healing 30 damage with 2 of these in your deck; that much healing and you don't even need block until act 4
which is around 1/3rd your max hp
assuming no max hp ups
Yes but the jump from 8 to 20 healing per combat is less important than 0 to 8
I would say it's about the same
If this was just healing it would be pretty bad
I do agree that there's some diminishing returns
but the jump from 8-20 is arithmetically a lot larger than 0-8
equalize good
no campfires ever
<slime boss deal damage heal rare>

embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Deal 8 (10) damage. Heal HP equal to unblocked damage.
**Exhaust**.

footer.text: <slime boss deal damage heal rare> = leech life, 76% sure

messages.content: equalize stacks up pretty well against leech life
which is a strange thing considering leech life is rare and equalize is not, they’re same cost, and equalize also isn’t ethereal
the only actual benefit of leech life is that you can recover whole hp bar with big goop/str in theory
slime boss enjoys leech life more than ironclade enjoys reaper
if i have an equalize i’m not going to be hunting leech life
unless i find myself with like no block somehow
you can easily heal 50 with a leech life
yes but the question is how useful that is
if you are healing 20 every combat do you need 50 more burst heal that acts as a clumsy sometimes
idk how useful is a fairy potion
slime boss also lacks mechanics to keep leech life
<show10 slime boss discard>

messages.content: nothing discards meaning when you get it you play it or lose it
it’s just wildly inconsistent
anyway
point being equalize probably needs a nerf
one healing uncommon probably shouldn’t obsolete the healing rare in 90% of scenarios
Wait a second how many times can you loop douse in slime effect with equalize
well if I'm right then no limit other than HP?
Or heart
So it's just effect stacks +2
I think it needs testing to be absolutely sure I'm not remembering this wrong but I'm pretty sure it works like I said
The +2 being from base copy and the normal goop attack
yeah it plays again on consume so if you still have goop it will consume again

Very powerful healing tool, asks very little of you (between mire slime, corrosive spit, licks, etc, you nearly always have some access to goop), and has a ridiculous upgrade considering that it applies twice if you meet the consume condition. The upgrade is notably overpowered, its a +4 to damage, and a +2 to healing, but because of how frequently that will get doubled by the consume effect, one upgrade ends up giving you an additional 8 damage and 4 healing, that should almost certainly be nerfed to maybe +2 damage and +1 healing, which would still often be +4 damage and +2 healing thanks to consume.

To be fair, yes slime boss already heals a fair bit with the starter relic, and has access to leech life and mass feed at rare, and can have very consistent block if you are looping the right lick or have good access to leeching slime and potency. Equalize is powerful enough in my opinion to still be a high priority pickup, and I don't really think you can have too much healing, as long as you have some offense as well, which equalize also provides. This is also often going to be better/more consistent than the rare leech life, since the damage and upgrade are much stronger, and it doesn't have ethereal. Leech life really needs tons of goop applied to shine, and equalize just asks far less of you.

Pretty fantastic in all acts, great in act 1 to help you aggressively trade health in hallway fights and heal back up, and you can take far more elites if you are healing for 8 (12) every fight with this. It is difficult to meet the consume condition in tri-sentries, but pretty easy into nob and lagavulin. It stays excellent into the very dangerous act 2, and will only really fall off later into act 3, where your deck hopefully is strong/fast/consistent enough to not need the healing, and scaling is more important. Excellent with runic pyramid, pretty good with snecko eye. This card is good enough to even buy from a shop if the price is right
